001package com.github.sormuras.bach.command;
002
003import java.nio.file.Files;
004import java.nio.file.Path;
005import java.util.ArrayList;
006import java.util.List;
007import java.util.Optional;
008
009/**
010 * The jar command creates an archive for classes and resources, and manipulates or restores
011 * individual classes or resources from an archive.
012 *
013 * @param mode The main operation mode like {@code --create}, {@code --list}, or {@code --update}.
014 * @param file Specifies the archive file name.
015 * @param verbose Sends or prints verbose output to standard output.
016 * @param additionals Aggregates additional command-line arguments.
017 * @param files Specifies the classes and resources to operate on.
018 * @see <a href="https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/16/docs/specs/man/jar.html">The jar
019 *     Command</a>
020 */
021public record JarCommand(
022    ModeOption mode,
023    FileOption file,
024    VerboseOption verbose,
025    AdditionalArgumentsOption additionals,
026    FilesOption files)
027    implements Command<JarCommand> {
028
029  public JarCommand() {
030    this(
031        ModeOption.empty(),
032        FileOption.empty(),
033        VerboseOption.empty(),
034        AdditionalArgumentsOption.empty(),
035        FilesOption.empty());
036  }
037
038  @Override
039  public String name() {
040    return "jar";
041  }
042
043  @Override
044  public JarCommand option(Option option) {
045    return new JarCommand(
046        option instanceof ModeOption mode ? mode : mode,
047        option instanceof FileOption file ? file : file,
048        option instanceof VerboseOption verbose ? verbose : verbose,
049        option instanceof AdditionalArgumentsOption additionals ? additionals : additionals,
050        option instanceof FilesOption files ? files : files);
051  }
052
053  public JarCommand mode(String mode) {
054    return option(new ModeOption(Optional.ofNullable(mode)));
055  }
056
057  public JarCommand file(Path file) {
058    return option(new FileOption(Optional.ofNullable(file)));
059  }
060
061  public JarCommand verbose(Boolean verbose) {
062    return option(new VerboseOption(Optional.ofNullable(verbose)));
063  }
064
065  @Override
066  public JarCommand additionals(AdditionalArgumentsOption additionals) {
067    return option(additionals);
068  }
069
070  public JarCommand withFiles(Path path) {
071    return withFiles(0, path);
072  }
073
074  public JarCommand withFiles(int version, Path path) {
075    return option(files.withPath(version, path));
076  }
077
078  @Override
079  public List<String> toArguments() {
080    var jar = Command.of(name());
081    if (mode.isPresent()) jar = jar.add(mode.get());
082    if (file.isPresent()) jar = jar.add("--file", file.get());
083    if (verbose.isTrue()) jar = jar.add("--verbose");
084    //
085    jar = jar.addAll(additionals.values());
086    //
087    if (files.isPresent()) {
088      for (int version = 0; version <= Runtime.version().feature(); version++) {
089        var targeting = files.targeting(version);
090        if (targeting.isEmpty()) continue;
091        if (version != 0) jar = jar.add("--release", version);
092        for (var targeted : targeting) {
093          for (var path : targeted.paths()) {
094            jar = Files.isDirectory(path) ? jar.add("-C", path, ".") : jar.add(path);
095          }
096        }
097      }
098    }
099    return jar.toArguments();
100  }
101
102  public record ModeOption(Optional<String> value) implements Option.Value<String> {
103    public static ModeOption empty() {
104      return new ModeOption(Optional.empty());
105    }
106  }
107
108  public record FileOption(Optional<Path> value) implements Option.Value<Path> {
109    public static FileOption empty() {
110      return new FileOption(Optional.empty());
111    }
112  }
113
114  public record FilesOption(List<TargetedPaths> values) implements Option.Values<TargetedPaths> {
115    public static FilesOption empty() {
116      return new FilesOption(List.of());
117    }
118
119    public FilesOption withPath(int version, Path path) {
120      var values = new ArrayList<>(this.values);
121      values.add(new TargetedPaths(version, List.of(path)));
122      return new FilesOption(values);
123    }
124
125    public List<TargetedPaths> targeting(int version) {
126      return values.stream().filter(targeted -> targeted.version() == version).toList();
127    }
128  }
129}
